Reason: The _journalSizeThreshold configuration is considered performance-sensitive. This is because the value of _journalSizeThreshold directly impacts the size threshold for the journal, which in turn affects the frequency of journal writes and disk usage. The code snippet in the journal() method shows that the _journalSizeThreshold value is used to create a PersistentJournal object, indicating that it plays a crucial role in the system's performance. Depending on the value set for _journalSizeThreshold, the system may experience notable performance variations in terms of disk usage and journal write frequency at the system level.
